title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Tuesday 6 February - BBC News
summary: 'hazardous waste incident ' at heanor industrial unit .
neighbouring businesses evacuated as firefighters work to make site safe .
'sling out ' hard brexiteers , soubry tells pm .
could 'female-friendly ' crisps be made in leicester ?
rugby : tigers ' ben youngs out for four months .

documents.title: city celebrates 25 years of laughter
text: city celebrates 25 years of laughter

text: swansea city 8-1 notts county
author: Dafydd Pritchard
BBC Sport Wales at the Liberty Stadium

documents.title: man lied about £ 1.6m bermuda theft
text: man lied about £ 1.6m bermuda theft

documents.title: four accused of £ 1.3m bermuda fraud
text: four accused of £ 1.3m bermuda fraud

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: today 's updates have now come to an end .
our live coverage will start again at 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: liz kendall pays tribute to suffragettes during debate
text: several mps wore tributes to suffragettes during a special house of commons debate this afternoon to mark 100 years since the law that let women vote for the first time .
leicester west mp liz kendall said `` the fight for equality never ends '' and called for more rights for female carers .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: chemical spill involved '1,000 litres of cyanide '
text: derbyshire fire service said the chemical spill in heanor involved 1,000 litres of liquid cyanide .
firefighters from around the county were called to the spill at an industrial estate in the town at about 13:30 this afternoon .
seven people were `` decontaminated '' and checked over by paramedics before being given the all clear .

we continue to work with colleagues from the environment agency and severn trent water to manage any risk to the environment and bring the incident to the quickest and safest conclusion , '' group manager gary platts said .
martin plant is director of scb logistics and said the spill happend in a car park at the neighbouring business .
he said : `` there were a lot of guys wandering round in chemical suits and a wash down area . ''

documents.title: watch : tonight 's weather for the east midlands
text: it 's going to be cold this evening .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: innovative surgery for fixing pelvis fractures
text: surgeons at nottingham university hospitals are taking a new approach to treating people who suffer a broken pelvis after a fall .
it involves having an mri scan followed by keyhole surgery to fill the fracture with a substance known as `` bone cement '' .
for 80-year-old stella travis it meant she was able to walk just two days after having spinal surgery .
ms travis said : it 's not perfect but it 's so much better .
i 'm hoping it will get better still . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: tea towels 'spontaneously combusted ' causing fire
text: a restaurant owner said that smoldering tea towels left in a laundry basket was the cause of a fire that ripped through her stock leaving around £ 25,000 worth of damage .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: watch : life with tinnitus for a 10-year-old boy
text: ten-year-old george describes life with tinnitus .
author: Chris Waring
BBC News

documents.title: thieves take children 's hos charity box
text: photos have been released of two women police want to speak to after a charity box raising money for a children 's hos was stolen .
the box was taken from the counter of the bluebell wood children 's hos shop in packers row , chesterfield , on friday 26 january .
police said one of the women allegedly distracted a member of staff while the other stole the box .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: design for mansfield hotel released
text: mansfield town has released an artist impression of a planned new hotel at the clubs one call stadium .
supporters are being asked to share their opinions during an exhibition at the ground today .
it 's in the kevin bird suite until 19:00 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: train company honours emergency services after fire
text: east midlands trains is to name one of its fleet after nottinghamshire fire and rescue service and the british transport police following a fire at nottingham railway station last month .

the train will be fitted with two nameplates to honour the organisations and there 'll be an official naming ceremony on 12 february - exactly one month since the blaze that closed the station all day .
it 's thought to be the only locomotive in the country to have two nameplates .
on behalf of british transport police , i 'd like to thank east midlands trains for this touching acknowledgement of their gratitude to the force .

i know my officers will probably say they were just doing their jobs , but the fact is they do n't always get the praise they deserve for putting themselves in danger every day , in order to protect the public , and it can be easy to take them for granted . ''
a 33-year-old woman from derby has been arrested on sus of arson following the fire .
she 's since been released while investigation continue .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: no threat from 'heavily diluted ' cyanide
text: here 's a little extra info from east midlands today .
gary platts from derbyshire fire & rescue service says a few litres of diluted ( 2 % ) waste cyanide was spilled here .
no risk to local population .
seven members of staff treated on site - all ok now .
scaling back operation now @ twitterid @ twitterid
just to let you know since thursdays heavy rain there have been a lot of fish found dead according to reports from a lot of local people who are on the park everyday
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: heanor chemical spill 'involved forklift truck '
text: there 's still a big emergency service presence in adams close in heanor after this afternoon 's chemical spill .
gary platts , from derbyshire fire and rescue service , said the accidental spillage involved a forklift truck and a container .
he reiterated there was no risk to people living nearby or the local water supply .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: water alert after cyanide spill in heanor
text: we 've had a little more information from derbyshire fire and rescue service on the chemical spill at an industrial unit in adams close , heanor .
a spokeswoman said firefighters had been dealing with an accidental spillage of cyanide waste liquid .
she said a small percentage had entered the watercourse but there was no threat to the local population or drinking water .
the fire service is working with the environment agency , severn trent water and the county council to assess the scale and risk to the environment .
seven workers were decontaminated after the spill .
we 're still awaiting confirmation of which business was involved .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: heanor waste incident : nearby businesses evacuated
text: we understand a number of businesses have been evacuated in adams close in heanor as emergency services deal with a `` hazardous waste incident '' at an industrial unit .
fire officers are working with the land owners to make the site safe .
the environment agency is also there to check if it 's caused any problems for nearby land .
we 're still awaiting details on the exact nature of the incident .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: lorry crash on m1
text: about to get on the m1 southbound ?
sorry to be the bearer of bad news but this might hamper your journey .
# leicester .
# m1 rtc involving two articulated lorries southbound from shepshed towards copt oak .
only the outside lane is moving very slowly .
care needed there .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: investigation into off-duty police officer 'a witch hunt '
text: derbyshire police federation says a senior detective should n't have had to go to a misconduct tribunal after he tackled a drunken man while he was off duty .
yesterday , insp matthew mozley was cleared of using excessive force to detain a man in heanor in 2015 .
it was investigated twice internally and three times by the crown prosecution service , but on each occasion it was found there was no case to answer .

tony wetton from derbyshire police federation described the situation as a `` witch hunt '' and said : `` you have to question what message it sends out to off duty and on duty officers - a bad outcome can mean years and years of investigation . ''
author: Lisa Teanby
Newsreader, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: christmas day homeless helper fined
text: christmas day homeless helper fined

documents.title: staff 'decontaminated ' after hazardous waste incident
text: it 's understood six workers have been decontaminated at an industrial unit in heanor after what the fire service has described as a `` hazardous waste incident '' .
we 're awaiting further information but have a reporter heading to the site , in adams close .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: breaking'hazardous waste incident ' in heanor
text: about 25 firefighters are at the scene of a `` hazardous waste incident '' at an industrial unit in heanor .
police , the ambulance service and the environment agency are also at the site in adams close .
we 're awaiting further information on what has happened .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: gritters sent out as more snow expected
text: an evening to avoid all-but-essential travel .
with snow expected across # leicester later this evening , our # gritting teams will be out across the city .
do n't forget , main roads , bus routes and other important commuter routes are our priority .
find details of them here :
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: pm 'doing what british people asked '
text: theresa may has responded to calls by the broxtowe mp anna soubry to remove `` hard ideological brexiteers '' from the conservative party .
ms soubry said it was time for the prime minister to `` get a spine '' and stand up to politicians , who she said were in danger of ruining the country with their policies .
when we leave the eu we 'll be able to see global britain standing tall and proud in the world and trading with other countries around the rest of the world as well .
we 're focused on doing what the british people asked us to do and that 's leaving the european union . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: appeal for information over sexual assault
text: police are appealing for information after a teenager was sexually assaulted as she walked down the street .
the 18-year-old woman reported the attack last month but it 's believed to have happened on 17 october at about 21:20 in beechdale road , nottingham .
the attacker is described at white , in his 30s , 6ft tall with short light hair and stubble on his face .
there is also a distinctive mark on his right temple .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: mahrez still absent at training
text: another day and still no riyad mahrez at training at leicester city .
he has n't reported for duty for a week now since his dream move to manchester city was turned down .
leicester play at manchester city this weekend and it looks increasingly unlikely mahrez will be in the team .
we understand internally leicester are trying to reintegrate mahrez back into the club .
author: Natalie Jackson
BBC East Midlands sports editor

documents.title: marking 100 years of women 's right to vote
text: you 've probably heard about this already , but today marks 100 years since women won the right to vote in the uk .
to mark the milestone , there are several events across the east midlands .
in derby , there 's an exhibition called on the shoulders of giants at the mandela centre and there 's a screening of the film suffragette at derby city council house tonight .
the national justice museum in nottingham has opened a right to vote exhibition , and in leicester , the statue of suffragette alice hawkins was unveiled at the weekend .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : snow in the east midlands
text: many thanks to tracey whitefoot for this lovely wintry shot of colwick park .
we also enjoyed this shot of newton linford .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: pensioner who forced cyclist off road gets three-year ban
text: a 67-year-old motorist who deliberately '' forced a cyclist off the road and caused them serious injuries has been disqualified from driving .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: watch : group sought over nottingham robbery
text: a video has been released of four men police want to speak to about a robbery and attempted robbery in nottingham .
police said a 28-year-old man was told to hand over his bag by four men in jubilee avenue at 19:30 on 10 january but he ran away without giving them anything .
two 18-year-old men were then robbed of their mobile phones in highfield park about 30 minutes later .
warning : video may contain third party content .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: foxes star mahrez 'acting like a big baby '
text: leicester midfielder riyad mahrez has been acting like `` a big baby '' since a potential deadline-day move to manchester city fell through , former england striker chris sutton said .
mahrez , 26 , who helped leicester to the premier league title in 2016 , handed in a transfer request in january .
foxes boss claude puel vowed to help the algerian back into the fold , but mahrez has not played since 20 january .
`` if i was one of his team-mates i 'd be deeply unhappy with him , '' sutton said .
`` he 's disappointed not to go to a bigger club , i understand that , but he has to see out his contract - so get on with it . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: newark teenager goes missing
text: a 17-year-old girl has gone missing from her home in newark .
emma-jayne mortiboy was last seen in the town yesterday and police say they 're concerned for her safety .
call 101 if you know where she might be ,

documents.title: photo appeal over fake £ 50 shop fraud
text: police want to speak to this man after a fake £ 50 note was used at a shop in mickleover .
officers said staff at the vicarage road stores spotted the forgery after a man paid for several items and left on 17 january .
it 's believed the same man was involved in a similar incident at a takeaway in ladybank road the day before .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: doctor 's manslaughter conviction prompts review
text: health secretary jeremy hunt announced a review into gross negligence manslaughter in healthcare following the dismissal of dr hadiza bawa-garba .
she was convicted of the manslaughter of six-year-old jack adcock at leicester royal infirmary and , last month , struck off by the general medical council .

mr hunt said : `` today i can announce that i have asked professor sir norman williams , former president of the royal college of surgeons and my senior clinical advisor to conduct a rapid review into the application of gross negligence manslaughter in healthcare . ''

it will look at `` where the line is drawn between gross negligence manslaughter and ordinary human error '' ; the process of learning from mistakes ; and any lessons that need to be learned by the gmc .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: watch : the man keeping mansfield 's streets safe
text: dave dawson has been hired by mansfield 's business improvement district to patrol almost 600 shops and market stalls .
he keeps an eye out for shoplifting and other criminal activity and has made 230 citizen 's arrests over the past 12 months .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : snow in the east midlands
text: much of the region had some snow overnight .
these photos were taken in ilam , shepshed and east leake .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: gardener makes greenhouse out of plastic bottles
text: a leicestershire gardener is encouraging neighbours to `` go green '' and reuse plastic .
laura greenan , from hinckley , built a greenhouse entirely out of plastic bottles to demonstrate the unique ways people can recycle - and to also showcase home grown food .
the greenhouse was built using garden canes and plastic bottles donated from people living in the area .
`` we put a sign up for people to drop bottles off , they 've been leaving black bin bags full of bottles . ''
`` i 'm doing it to raise awareness of recycling in the community and also encourage people to do their own gardening . ''
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: hundreds sign petition to stop children 's centres closing
text: parents are campaigning to stop the proposed closure of children 's centres across leicestershire .
a total of 25 facilities are under threat as part of county council plans to merge and re-shape the services on offer .
hundreds of signatures have been collected for a petition opposing the closure of any of the centres .
ivan ould , cabinet member for children and families , said the authority would be listening to views expressed in a consultation on the shake-up which runs until april .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: driver 'lucky to be alive ' after rolling car
text: a warning from derbyshire police
a517 near hulland ward .
the result of drink driving .
lost control on a bend , through a gate & multiple roll overs .
lucky to be alive with minor injuries .
74ųg roadside breath sample .
# dontdrinkanddrive
should be zero tolerance , if you 're driving do n't drink !
that 'll need some t cut
courts need to come down harder on drink drivers as the message is still not getting across to some # lockthemup
not only put their life at risk but also the lives of innocent members of the public !
no car , out of pocket and probably no job now .
could have been much worse had he hit someone .
potential killer .
waiting for 'probably an audi driver , from the ford fiesta brigade .
@ twitterid thought you 'd like this
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: farm animals prepare for cold day
text: these two certainly look prepared for a cold day ahead .
the snow has n't stopped tilly and fairy at stonebridge city farm in nottingham from enjoying the fresh air .
this was the scene at the farm earlier today .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: could 'female-friendly ' crisps be made in leicester ?
text: the chief executive of walkers crisps ' parent company pepsico has been ridiculed after revealing the firm is working on a range of crisps specifically aimed at women .
indra nooyi said the new product would fit more easily in handbags and make less noise when crunched .
it 's not clear if leicester-based walkers would be involved in manufacturing the new range but the concept has been widely mocked on social media .
author julie owen moylan tweeted : `` we need ickle pink packets with ickle pink crisps for our lady mouths . ''
the bbc has contacted pepsico for more informaiton .
we need ickle pink packets with ickle pink crisps for our lady mouths
i suppose you could n't begin to cope with pork scratchings ?
are you crazy ?
with our delicate lady mouths and lady teeth ?
i 've seen a few women rugby players who look like they may be able to cope with pork scratchings .
but i would n't want to jump to conclusions .
oh happy day !
this is just what i needed in place of being paid equal to a man for the same kind and amount of work !
yep doritos are saving the day with lady snacks
i suggested a new brand of office supplies for her as well .
@ twitterid - we the consumers would like to welcome you to the 21st century where 19th century norms are outdated and women have the vote and even wear pants to work .
pretty princess pink potato crisps ?
it 's what you 've been fighting for surely
my wife lugs 40 kg cages of food about all day while i sit in an office and type .
she 's twice as tough as i am .
at least .
what she does n't need as some patronising tosser telling her how delicate she is .
but is her jaw strong enough for doritos ?
are you old enough to remember jaws '' in james bond ?
my wife is considerably better looking but
hahaha !
quality bad guy !
could n't resist
i can see their advertising for this misogynistic idea .
`` get your man to buy you some nice lady crisps ''
but you 're okay with doritos targeting only males within their marketing ?
what happened to # timesup ?
and why is female `` pink '' to you ?
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: rugby : tigers ' ben youngs 'out for four months '
text: it 's been confirmed that leicester tigers scrum-half ben youngs will miss the rest of the six nations after damaging knee ligaments in england 's victory over italy .
the leicester player was injured early on in the 46-15 win in rome and scans revealed a rupture of the medial collateral ligament in his left knee .
the 28-year-old is due for further assessment this week but is expected to be sidelined for four months .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: city council to sell new walk centre site
text: leicester city council is to sell the site of its former headquarters in new walk for £ 24,000 .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: 'emaciated ' dogs found at leicester property
text: a 22-year-old man has been banned from keeping dogs for five years after two emaciated dogs were found at his home .
the rspca said cameron deazle , of neston gardens in leicester , initially denied owning the dogs .
he contacted the council to collect two strays - one of the dogs was found to have recently died at the property .
at leicester magistrates ' court last month he pleaded guilty to causing unnecessary suffering to the staffordshire bull terriers .
he was sentenced to 16 weeks imprisonment , as well as another eight weeks imprisonment for breaching a conditional discharge , suspended for 18 months .
he was also banned from keeping dogs for five years .
sadly , as a result of these two dogs being left at the property for a long period with little or no food , one of the dogs sadly died and it was a close call for the other .
they were both very skinny and this would have caused both dogs extreme suffering . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: broken train barriers affecting nottingham buses
text: the stuck train barriers at david lane continue to be a problem this morning
there are severe delays on yellow 68 , 69 , 70 , 71. due to this .
# nctlive
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: violence in long eaton and sandiacre 'not gang affiliated '
text: derbyshire police say the violence in and around long eaton and sandiacre over the weekend was between two groups of school-age children and not gang affiliated .
on saturday , a 15-year-old boy was stabbed in springfield park following reports of violence in the area .
he 's now recovering at home .
a 17 year-old-from nottingham was arrested and has been released while inquiries continue .
sgt rich price from the long eaton neighbourhood policing team said it was an `` isolated incident '' but he 's aware of anti-social behaviour in the area .
`` there have been other issues come to light lately with youths riding bikes in shops and generally making a nuisance of themselves - but that 's unrelated to the incident on saturday night . ''
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham fire station used as homeless shelter
text: the drop in temperature last night meant nottingham 's emergency rough sleepers policy kicked in - and london road fire station opened its doors to the homeless .
british red cross and homeless charity `` framework '' were involved in making sure the building was suitable for everyone who used it .
madeline farrar from the british red cross says it 's quite `` perplexing '' to be based inside a fire station , but they do n't interfere with its day-to-day running .
she added : `` we 're in a community room where we can provide chairs , sleeping bags , hot drinks and generally offer support for beneficiaries . ''
the use of the building as a rough sleeping shelter follows a successful pilot scheme last month .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: 'sling out ' hard brexiteers , soubry tells pm
text: the conservative mp for broxtowe anna soubry has called on the prime minister theresa may to `` sling out '' hard line brexiteers .
ms soubry told bbc newsnight that her front bench `` is in hock to 35 hard brexiteers who are not tories '' .
she added that she is prepared to leave her party unless the prime minister challenges her opponents .
author: BBC Newsnight

documents.title: motorway pothole 'damages several cars '
text: a pothole which has opened up on the m1 has apparently damaged several cars this morning and is causing significant delays .
highways england said the hole is across two lanes of the motorway with only one lane now open .
workers are on their way to repair the damage .
leicester 's area traffic control said it is causing severe delays with traffic queuing from junction 25 for nottingham .
# leicestershire 's motorways a formation of a pothole has emerged across two lanes ; m1 southbound between j24 and j23a ; , damaging several cars in the process .
two lanes are closed ; only one running at this time .
# leicester travel news
itll get filled in smartish as the council/highways wo n't want to pay compensation .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: air ambulance crew prepared for call outs
text: the crew from derbyshire , leicestershire and rutland air ambulance are prepared for the day
snowy morning here at @ twitterid but we 're ready to respond for @ twitterid and @ twitterid if needed .
they crew have deployed thermals and a hot flask ( non-alcoholic ! )
# tweetusdontmeetus
snowy scenes over loughborough this afternoon .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: traffic : delays across the region
text: - two lanes are closed on the m1 southbound between junctions 23a and 23 because a pothole has appeared across two lanes
- there are long delays on the a38 at fradley because an accident has closed the southbound carriageway between alrewas and fradley
- an accident is slowing traffic on the a515 between uttoxeter and marchington
-there 's been a breakdown on the m1 southbound between j29 ( chesterfield ) and j28 ( alfreton ) traffic is still moving , but is backing up .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

text: teen who self-harmed finds boxing refuge

documents.title: train barriers fail at railway crossing
text: drivers have been told to avoid david lane near bulwell because the train barriers are stuck .
the barriers at david lane are stuck down .
avoid the area , use alternative route .
an engineer is on site .

text: here is how tuesday is shaping up .

BBC weather presenter

documents.title: buses running as normal
text: good news for people who are due to catch the bus this morning
morning !
there are currently no disruptions due to the snow .
services may be delayed due to slower than normal traffic because of the weather conditions .
# nctlive

documents.title: traffic : updates from across the region
text: it looks fairly quiet on the roads so far .
one lane is closed on the m1 southbound between junctions 29 for mansfield and 28 for alfreton because of a broken down vehicle .
drivers are also being warned of `` heavy snowfall '' in leicestershire .
traffic alert - 0533hrs - heavy snow falling and settling north of the county especially around east midlands airport and j23 to j24 of m1 .
drive safely
thank you ! !
author: Maryam Qaiser

documents.title: join us for our live coverage
text: good morning east midlands .
it looks like the snow is back - at least for some of the region .
we 'll be bringing you today 's news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News
